fields.label: Lab Types
fields.tooltip: Choose from these predefined lab types. These lab types are calculated based on component lab area combinations entered by users. Advanced users may filter the component lab area percentages directly using the sliders on the Lab Types popup instead.

fields.label: Climate Zones
fields.tooltip: Use this filter to show buildings only from selected climate zones.
Select whether to include just existing buildings or also buildings not yet constructed (with projected energy consumption data).
fields.add_tooltip: Indicate whether this is a real building (existing or in design), or just test data. We want to keep fake buildings out of the peer group dataset!
fields.label: Building Status

fields.tooltip: Measured data is read at a meter (as reported by building owner). Estimated data may have been apportioned from readings of a meter serving more than one building, may have been an estimate based on previous years' usage, or for new buildings may have been taken from an energy model.
fields.label: Data Type

fields.tooltip: The fraction of the building gross sf that is occupied by lab spaces.
fields.add_tooltip: Lab area is generally speaking the total area of spaces in the building requiring 100% outside air for ventilation, including open labs and support spaces such as equipment rooms, procedure rooms, etc. It also includes physics labs, maker spaces, and cleanrooms, which may include recirculated air. It does not include language labs, computer labs, or other similar non-lab spaces. Lab area is less than total building area! Note: minimum allowed value is 500 sf.
fields.label: % Lab Area
Data Year
fields.tooltip: Use this filter to limit the years from which utility data should be displayed, e.g. to show only data from the past 5 years. Note: at present, the charting interface only looks at the most recent year of data for each building.
fields.add_tooltip: Enter year for which utility data was gathered (tool accepts 2000 or later). Year should be same for all fuels. Calendar year data is preferred but not required.

fields.label: Organization Type
fields.add_tooltip: Choose the option that most closely matches the type of organization that occupies the building.

fields.label: Predominant Lab Use Types
fields.add_tooltip: Choose the option that most closely represents the type of work done in the building's labs.

fields.label: Facility Name
fields.add_tooltip: Give your building a name you'll recognize. Note: once created, your facility's name can be edited via the Your Buildings list.

fields.label: Address (Street & City)
fields.add_tooltip: Format however is most useful to you; specific street addresses are not checked by the tool.

fields.label: Zip Code (5 Digits)
fields.tooltip: Enter 5-digit zipcode (US only).

fields.label: Net Floor Area (sf)
fields.add_tooltip: Net assignable space only, i.e. excludes circulation spaces, restrooms, utility spaces, mechanical rooms etc. This is an optional field. Net area must be less than gross area. Note: minimum allowed value is 500 sf.

fields.label: Number of (Lab) Buildings
fields.add_tooltip: This is normally 1. If you are entering data for a group of buildings together (not typical), enter number of buildings in group.

fields.label: Gross Floor Area (sf)
fields.tooltip: This is the total building area (aka gross square footage), excluding open areas like parking garages, guard shacks, etc.
fields.add_tooltip: Include total floor area of building (aka gross square footage) but exclude area of open spaces such as parking garages, guard shacks, etc. Note: minimum allowed value is 500 sf.

fields.label: Occupied Hours per Week
fields.tooltip: The total number of hours per week that the building is occupied at normal levels. This does not include occasional overnight occupancy.
fields.add_tooltip: The number of hours per week when the building is occupied at normal levels (do not include occasional overnight use in this total).

fields.tooltip: The total number of occupants per sf present during normal operations.
fields.add_tooltip: The total number of occupants present during normal operations.
fields.label: Total Number of Occupants per sf
Year Built
fields.tooltip: Year of construction (or most recent gut renovation).
fields.add_tooltip: Year of construction or most recent gut renovation. If unknown, please provide an estimate. Nearest decade is OK.  Note: earliest allowed year is 1800.

fields.label: State
fields.tooltip: Enter 2-letter state abbreviations. Use capital letters and follow each abbreviation with a comma. US states only.
fields.add_tooltip: US states only

fields.label: Predominant HVAC System Type
fields.add_tooltip: Select the best match to the HVAC system type serving the building's lab spaces.

values.label: Dedicated Outdoor Air Supply with Chilled Beams
Dedicated Outdoor Air Supply with Fan Coil Units

fields.label: Predominant HVAC Control Type
fields.add_tooltip: Select the best match to the HVAC control system type serving the building's lab spaces.

fields.tooltip: The predominant type of exhaust air energy recovery system serving the building's lab spaces.
fields.add_tooltip: Select the best match for the type of exhaust air energy recovery system (if any) serving the building's lab spaces.
fields.label: Exhaust Air Energy Recovery
Predominant Cooling System Type
fields.add_tooltip: Select the best match to the cooling system serving the building's lab spaces.

values.label: District Cooling / CHW from Campus Central Plant
Chiller Plant in Building: Air Cooled
Chiller Plant in Building: Water Cooled

fields.label: Predominant Heating System Type
fields.add_tooltip: Select the best match to the heating system serving the building's lab spaces.

values.label: Boiler Plant in Building: Condensing HW Boilers
Boiler Plant in Building: Non-Condensing HW Boilers
Boiler Plant in Building: Steam Boilers
District Heating / HW or Steam from Campus Central Plant

fields.label: Geothermal Heat Pump
fields.add_tooltip: Indicate whether building is served by geothermal (ground-source) heat pumps.

fields.label: Heat Recovery Chiller
fields.add_tooltip: Indicate whether the building is equipped with a heat recovery chiller providing chilled water and hot water.

fields.label: Low Pressure Drop Design - Air Side
Building-level CHP
fields.tooltip: Type of any cogeneration system in the building (does not include campus central plants).
fields.add_tooltip: Indicate whether building is equipped with an on-site combined heat and power system. Do not include campus central plants in this answer.
Indicate whether the building is equipped with any on-site renewable energy generation. Do not include campus-wide or off-site renewables.
fields.label: Renewable Energy Generation at Building
Low Pressure Drop Design - Water Side

fields.tooltip: The majority of ULT (-80C) freezers in the building are of high-efficiency (e.g. ENERGY STAR certified) type.
fields.add_tooltip: Indicate whether the majority of ULT (-80C) freezers in the building are of high-efficiency (e.g. ENERGY STAR certified) type.
fields.label: High-Efficiency ULT Freezers
Supply Air Temperature Reset
fields.tooltip: Supply air temperature reset (demand or outside temperature based) for air handling systems serving labs.

fields.label: Static Pressure Reset - Supply Air
fields.tooltip: Demand-based duct static pressure setpoint reset controls for supply air handling systems serving labs.

fields.label: Static Pressure Reset - Exhaust Air
fields.tooltip: Demand-based duct static pressure setpoint reset controls for exhaust air handling systems serving labs.

fields.label: Unoccupied Airflow Setback in Labs
fields.tooltip: Reduced minimum airflow setpoints for lab spaces during unoccupied periods. May include an occupancy override via sensor or override button.

fields.label: Unoccupied Temp Setback in Labs
fields.tooltip: Widened room temperature deadband for lab spaces during unoccupied periods. May include an occupancy override via sensor or override button.
Demand-based reset of hydronic loop differential pressure setpoint.
fields.label: Pump Head Reset

fields.tooltip: Reset of minimum exhaust stack velocity based on actual (live) measured wind conditions.
fields.label: Exhaust Fan - Wind Speed Response

fields.tooltip: Reset of lab minimum airflow rates based on actual (live) measured air quality.
fields.label: Chemical Sensing and Airflow Response in Labs

fields.tooltip: Total number of ducted fume hoods in the facility. Ducted fume hoods are connected to the building exhaust system.
fields.label: Ducted Fume Hoods per sf of Lab Space

fields.tooltip: Total number of filtering fume hoods in the facility. Filtering fume hoods contain fans and filters to extract chemical contaminants from hood air. This count does not include biosafety cabinets.
fields.add_tooltip: Filtering fume hoods contain fans and filters to extract chemical contaminants from hood air. Do not include biosafety cabinets in this count.
fields.label: Filtering Fume Hoods per sf of Lab Space

fields.add_tooltip: The total length of fume hoods (ducted and filtering) in the building.
fields.add_label: Total Linear ft of Fume Hoods
fields.label: Linear ft of Fume Hoods per sf of Lab

fields.tooltip: Predominant design sash height for fume hoods.
fields.add_tooltip: Predominant design sash height for fume hoods in the building. Note: tool accepts values between 6 and 30 in.
fields.label: Fume Hood Operating Sash Height (inches)

fields.add_tooltip: Design hood face velocity under occupied conditions. Normally between 60 and 100 fpm. Tool accepts values between 20 and 200 fpm.
fields.tooltip: Design hood face velocity under occupied conditions. Normally between 60 and 100 fpm.
fields.label: Fume Hood Face Velocity (ft/min)
Predominant Fume Hood Control Type
fields.add_tooltip: Choose the option that most closely matches the predominant fume hood control type in the building.

fields.label: Automatic Sash Closers
fields.tooltip: Indicates whether a significant fraction of the hoods in the building are equipped with automatic sash closing devices.
fields.add_tooltip: Select Y if a significant fraction of hoods in the building are equipped with automatic sash closing devices.

fields.label: Hood Face Velocity Setback
fields.add_tooltip: Select Y if a significant fraction of hoods in the building are equipped with occupancy-based hood face velocity setback controls.
fields.tooltip: Indicates whether a significant fraction of hoods in the building are equipped with occupany-based hood face velocity setback controls.
The predominant minimum ventilation rate assigned to occupied labs in the building. Normally assigned by EH&S department.
fields.add_tooltip: The predominant minimum ventilation rate assigned to occupied labs in the building. Normally assigned by EH&S department. Tool accepts values between 0.1 and 50 ACH.
fields.label: Laboratory Occupied Minimum Air Change Rate (ACH)
Laboratory Unoccupied Minimum Air Change Rate (ACH)
fields.tooltip: The predominant minimum ventilation rate assigned to unoccupied labs in the building. Normally assigned by EH&S.
fields.add_tooltip: The predominant minimum ventilation rate assigned to unoccupied labs in the building. Normally assigned by EH&S. Tool accepts values between 0.1 and 50 ACH.

fields.tooltip: Indicates whether a space-by-space hazard analysis was used to set required ventilation rates.
fields.add_tooltip: Was a space-by-space hazard analysis used to set required ventilation rates?
fields.label: Hazard Assessment Used to Establish Min ACH

fields.tooltip: Biological labs are used for biology and life sciences, including medical research. They may have fume hoods and biosafety cabinets. They also tend to have thermal environments (e.g. cold rooms, warm rooms) and equipment rooms.
fields.label: Biology (%)

fields.tooltip: Chemistry labs are used for organic, inorganic, physical and analytical chemistry. They are typically fume hood intensive.
fields.label: Chemistry (%)

fields.tooltip: Physics/engineering labs are typically 'dry' labs. They tend to have high plug loads and may include clean spaces, laser tables, etc.
fields.label: Physics/Engineering (%)

fields.tooltip: Vivarium spaces are used for animal housing. Also includes animal procedure rooms and vivarium support spaces.
fields.add_tooltip: Vivarium spaces are used for animal housing. Animal procedure rooms and vivarium support spaces should be included in vivarium area.
fields.label: Vivarium (%)

fields.tooltip: Maker/workshop spaces are typically not highly controlled environments but may include machine shops and industrial art spaces.
fields.label: Maker/Workshop (%)

fields.tooltip: Types of lab space not covered by any of the above categories.
fields.add_tooltip: Use this for types of lab space not covered by any of the above categories.
fields.label: Other (%)

fields.tooltip: Total data center load in the building.
fields.add_tooltip: If the building has a significant data center electrical load, enter approx load here.
fields.label: Data Center kW

fields.tooltip: Total number of ULT (-80C) freezers in the facility.
fields.add_tooltip: Enter total number of ultra-low temperature (-80C) freezers here. ULT freezers may be in freezer farms or in lab spaces. Tool accepts values up to 1000.
fields.label: Number of ULT Freezers

fields.tooltip: Use this to filter for buildings with or without major imaging equipment such as MRIs and PETs
fields.add_tooltip: Indicate whether the building includes major imaging equipment such as MRIs and PETs.
fields.label: Major Imaging Equipment (MRIs, PETs)
BSL3/4 areas
fields.add_tooltip: The total area of BSL3/BSL4 areas in the building. Please also include this area in the total lab areas by type above.

fields.label: ISO 5/Class 100
fields.add_tooltip: The total area of ISO 5 / Class 100 clean rooms in the building. Please also include this area in the total lab areas by type above.

fields.label: ISO 6/Class 1000
fields.add_tooltip: The total area of ISO 6 / Class 100 clean rooms in the building. Please also include this area in the total lab areas by type above.

fields.label: ISO 7/Class 10000
fields.add_tooltip: The total area of ISO 7 / Class 10000 clean rooms in the building. Please also include this area in the total lab areas by type above.

fields.label: Annual Total Energy Cost ($)
fields.add_tooltip: Total annual cost of above utilities in US dollars.

fields.tooltip: Total potable water usage. Includes cooling tower water use where present.
fields.label: Water Usage

fields.tooltip: Total water + sewer cost.
fields.label: Annual Water Cost ($)
Overall Peak Electric Demand (kW)
fields.tooltip: Maximum annual electrical demand. If data is available for multiple intervals, use 15-minute interval.

fields.label: Annual On-Site Renewable Elec. Generated (kWh)
fields.tooltip: Total amount of electricity generated by on-site renewables such as building-mounted solar photovoltaics or building-mounted wind turbines. This should only include renewables that reduce electric consumption recorded by the main electric meter for the building.

fields.label: Process/Plug Annual Electric Usage (kWh)
fields.tooltip: Electricity consumed by equipment plugged into electrical outlets (plus any other process equipment that consumes electricity) in the building. Data normally only available if end-use electrical submeters are installed.

fields.label: Process/Plug Peak Electric Demand (kW)
fields.tooltip: Peak electric demand of equipment plugged into electrical outlets (plus any other process equipment that consumes electricity) in the building. Data normally only available if end-use electrical submeters are installed.

fields.label: Ventilation System Annual Elec. Usage (kWh)
fields.tooltip: Electricity consumed by ventilation equipment (i.e. fans) in the building. Data normally only available if end-use electrical submeters are installed.

fields.label: Ventilation System Peak Elec. Demand (kW)
fields.tooltip: Peak electric demand of ventilation equipment (i.e. fans) in the building. Data normally only available if end-use electrical submeters are installed.

fields.label: Building Peak Airflow (cfm)
fields.tooltip: Peak total building ventilation (outside) airflow, including air delivered to both lab and non-lab areas.

fields.label: Cooling Plant Annual Electric Usage (kWh)
fields.tooltip: Electricity consumed by cooling plant equipment (chillers, pumps, cooling tower fans) in the building. Include energy consumed by AHU DX cooling systems if applicable and available. Data normally only available if end-use electrical submeters are installed.

fields.label: Cooling Plant Peak Electric Demand (kW)
fields.tooltip: Peak electric demand of cooling plant equipment (chillers, pumps, cooling tower fans, and AHU DX cooling systems if applicable) in the building. Data normally only available if end-use electrical submeters are installed.

fields.label: Peak Cooling Load (tons)
fields.tooltip: Peak cooling load (measured in tons) from the building. This may be available from chiller plant historical data, or may be estimated based on experience with the building systems.

fields.label: Cooling Plant Capacity (tons)
fields.tooltip: Total cooling capacity (in tons) of any cooling plant equipment (chillers and any DX rooftop AHUs) installed in the building.

fields.label: Lighting Annual Electric Usage (kWh)
fields.tooltip: Electricity consumed by lighting systems in the building. Data normally only available if end-use electrical submeters are installed.

fields.label: Lighting Peak Electric Demand (kW)
fields.tooltip: Peak electric demand from lighting systems in the building. Data normally only available if end-use electrical submeters are installed.

fields.label: Installed Lighting W/sf in Labs
fields.tooltip: Average lighting power density (in watts per sf) of lighting installed in lab spaces in the building. Often available from code compliance forms and/or lighting design documentation; may also be estimated based on installed fixtures.
